image_caption: On the screen, the face of a 40 year old female patient is visible. The female patient is staring at the screen with a neutral expression.

dialogue.system: How are you feeling right now?
dialogue.user: The situation is stable now.

dialogue.system: Do you have any medications that you usually take?
dialogue.user: I usually don't take medicine well. Seizures occur only once or twice a year.

dialogue.system: When do seizures usually occur?
dialogue.user: Sometimes when a lot of people look at me, I can't breathe and my heart beats fast.

belief_state.panic triggering situation: when a lot of people look at me

image_caption: A 20-year-old male patient is in front of me to be consulted by me about mental illness. He looks fear.

dialogue.system: Are you very uncomfortable right now?
dialogue.user: My heart is beating so fast that I can't breathe.

dialogue.system: Breathe slowly, I'll be there to help
dialogue.user: (breathing)

dialogue.system: Do you often have seizure symptoms?
dialogue.user: Yes. Symptoms often appear like this, so I can't do my daily life at all.

dialogue.system: Do you have any medications that you take regularly?
dialogue.user: There are medications prescribed by a psychiatrist. I've been taking it for 6 months.

image_caption: On the screen, the face of a 25 year old female patient is visible. She came to me for counseling about mental illness. She's mood on the screen looks embarrassment.

dialogue.system: Are you very uncomfortable right now?
dialogue.user: I was sweating too much when I had a seizure earlier.

dialogue.system: Do you sweat a lot when you have a seizure?
dialogue.user: Yes. When a seizure occurs, the whole body is wet with sweat.

dialogue.system: When do panic symptoms usually start?
dialogue.user: If you get behind the wheel, yes.

dialogue.system: Which of the physical symptoms, fearful thoughts, and avoidance of the factor comes first?
dialogue.user: I think the physical symptoms appear first.

image_caption: A 30-year-old female patient is shown on the screen. She came to me for counseling about mental illness. First of all, She's mood on the screen looks embarrassment.

dialogue.system: Are you very uncomfortable right now?
dialogue.user: Just a moment ago, I couldn't breathe.

dialogue.system: Do you find it difficult to breathe when you have a seizure?
dialogue.user: Yes. When I have a seizure, my breathing quickens and my heart feels like it's going to jump out.

dialogue.system: Under what circumstances do panic symptoms usually start?
dialogue.user: I think it's when i hear a loud noise or a fight.

belief_state.panic triggering situation: when i hear a loud noise or a fight

dialogue.system: How long do symptoms last once they appear?
dialogue.user: I'm not sure. I think it's 10 minutes.

image_caption: A 16-year-old male patient is shown on the screen. He came to me for counseling about mental illness. First of all, He's mood on the screen looks neutral.

dialogue.system: Look comfortable now. Is it before a panic attack? Is it after a seizure?
dialogue.user: I haven't had a seizure yet.

dialogue.system: Under what circumstances do your panic symptoms usually start?
dialogue.user: It seems to appear when i have an important exam ahead

belief_state.panic triggering situation: when i have an important exam ahead

dialogue.system: What are the symptoms of panic?
dialogue.user: I feel the fear of dying.

panic disorder symptoms: Feeling out of control or going crazy, fear of dying

dialogue.system: How long did it last?
dialogue.user: I'm not sure, but about 10 minutes.

image_caption: On the screen, the face of a 35 year old male patient is visible. The male patient is staring at the screen with a happy expression.

dialogue.system: How are you today? I think you've improved a lot.
dialogue.user: Yes, I feel that way too. The frequency of seizures has been greatly reduced.

dialogue.system: How often have you had seizures in the last 6 months?
dialogue.user: I'm thinking of doing it once a month.

dialogue.system: What are the seizure symptoms?
dialogue.user: I feel cold and shiver. Once symptoms appear, they last for 15 minutes.

dialogue.system: It must have been so hard. Are you taking the medicine regularly?
dialogue.user: Yes. I am taking the medicine prescribed last time.

image_caption: A 23-year-old male patient is in front of me to be consulted by me about mental illness. he looks unrest.

dialogue.system: Are you currently experiencing panic attack symptoms?
dialogue.user: Yes. I suddenly sweat a lot, and I can hear my heart beating too loudly.

dialogue.system: Take a long breath for 30 seconds. There will be no problem.
dialogue.user: Ok

dialogue.system: When do seizure symptoms usually appear?
dialogue.user: It shows up when i hear the doorbell. The doorbell sounds so scary.

dialogue.system: The doorbell won't hurt you. If symptoms occur, how long will they last?
dialogue.user: About 15 minutes.

dialogue.system: What do you usually do when you have a seizure?
dialogue.user: I felt a little better after I hid under the blanket and counted.

dialogue.system: You've found a way to deal with it. Well done.
dialogue.user: Thanks

image_caption: A 27-year-old female patient is shown on the screen. she came to me for counseling about mental illness. First of all, she's mood on the screen looks happy.

dialogue.system: Do you have a good feeling?
dialogue.user: I haven't had a seizure in the last 6 months.

belief_state.panic frequency: not had a seizure in the last 6 months

dialogue.system: Good for you. Have you not had a seizure in the midst of a panic-triggering situation?
dialogue.user: Yes, it's okay to make loud noises now.

dialogue.system: Are you okay with your fear of having a panic attack?
dialogue.user: Yes, whenever I am afraid, I keep repeating that panic cannot harm me.

dialogue.system: You've improved a lot. Well done.
dialogue.user: Thank you

image_caption: On the screen, the face of a 15 year old female patient is visible. The female patient is staring at the screen with a neutral expression.

dialogue.system: Are there any special circumstances that trigger a panic attack?
dialogue.user: I'm afraid to wash. I feel fear at the sound of water. I'm so scared I think I'm going to die.

belief_state.panic triggering situation: feel fear at the sound of water
panic disorder symptoms: Feeling out of control or going crazy, fear of dying

dialogue.system: What do you think about when you have a seizure?
dialogue.user: The sound resonates in my head and I feel like I'm going crazy.

panic disorder symptoms: Feeling out of control or going crazy, fear of dying

dialogue.system: Panic symptoms won't hurt you. It doesn't even reach.
dialogue.user: Is it really so?

dialogue.system: Your test results are normal. You have to realize that panic symptoms won't hurt you.
dialogue.user: Yes, I will try.

image_caption: A 34-year-old male patient is in front of me to be consulted by me about mental illness. he looks hurt.

dialogue.system: Are there specific situations in which panic attacks occur?
dialogue.user: It seems to happen especially well when I've had a rough day at work.

belief_state.panic triggering situation: when I've had a rough day at work

dialogue.system: What's so hard on you at work?
dialogue.user: I don't get along well with my boss at work. I often can't breathe when I'm working..

dialogue.system: There is a lot of job stress. Are you okay at home?
dialogue.user: Yes, it's fine at home.

image_caption: A 65-year-old female patient is in front of me to be consulted by me about mental illness. she looks sad.

dialogue.system: What are you uncomfortable with?
dialogue.user: I'm so scared to enter a windowless room, but there's no way to solve it.

dialogue.system: How hard is it to enter a windowless room?
dialogue.user: It's frustrating and scary. I think I'm going crazy.

panic disorder symptoms: Feeling out of control or going crazy, fear of dying

dialogue.system: How long did your symptoms last?
dialogue.user: I'm not sure, but about 20 minutes.

dialogue.system: Did you get an emergency medicine prescription?
dialogue.user: Yes, I was prescribed Alprazolam.

dialogue.system: Do you eat every time you have a panic attack?
dialogue.user: Yes, it gets better after taking medicine.

image_caption: A 22-year-old male patient is shown on the screen. he came to me for counseling about mental illness. First of all, he's mood on the screen looks neutral.

dialogue.system: Are you having trouble with your daily life due to panic?
dialogue.user: I can't take the commuter bus because I have seizures when I take the commuter bus.

dialogue.system: You feel uncomfortable riding the bus. How about taking the commuter bus?
dialogue.user: My heart aches and I feel nauseous. These symptoms appear every time I get on the bus.

dialogue.system: Were there any other symptoms?
dialogue.user: I was dizzy and my hands and feet were numb.

panic disorder symptoms: Feeling dizzy, unsteady, dazed, or about to faint
Numbness or numbness or tingling in the limbs

dialogue.system: How long did your symptoms last?
dialogue.user: It was probably about 20-30 minutes.

image_caption: A 20-year-old female patient is shown on the screen. she came to me for counseling about mental illness. First of all, she's mood on the screen looks angry.

dialogue.system: Are panic attacks interfering with your daily life?
dialogue.user: Yes, I have seizures three or four times a week. I don't want to live anymore.

belief_state.panic frequency: three or four times a week

dialogue.system: You have to cheer up. In what situations do seizures usually occur?
dialogue.user: I'm not sure, but it shows up when I need to call.

dialogue.system: Are you afraid of making a phone call?
dialogue.user: Yes, I'm so nervous about having to make a phone call. My whole body was wet with sweat.

dialogue.system: I see. Were there any other symptoms?
dialogue.user: My heart was beating fast so that i cannot breathe, and my hands and feet were numb, so I had to keep kneading them.

panic disorder symptoms: Numbness or numbness or tingling in the limbs

dialogue.system: You must have had a big problem in your daily life. Do you have any prescribed medications?
dialogue.user: No, I kept putting up with not going to the hospital, but now it's hard.

image_caption: On the screen, the face of a 17 year old male patient is visible. The male patient is staring at the screen with a unrest expression.

dialogue.system: You have a very bad complexion. Are you experiencing any symptoms?
dialogue.user: Yes. My heart beat is so loud that it deafens my ears.

dialogue.system: Are there any other symptoms?
dialogue.user: I feel nauseous.

dialogue.system: Under what circumstances do you usually have panic attack symptoms?
dialogue.user: I guess it's like when i visit a new place. It's fine at home or at work.

belief_state.panic triggering situation: when i visit a new place

dialogue.system: How long do symptoms last once they appear?
dialogue.user: It's different every time, but about 30 minutes.

dialogue.system: What is frequency of your seizure?
dialogue.user: Not sure, but maybe once or twice a week.

image_caption: A 15-year-old female patient is in front of me to be consulted by me about mental illness. she looks happy.

dialogue.system: Your expression brightened. How are you feeling these days?
dialogue.user: Panic is not scary anymore. I'm fine thanks to the advice.

dialogue.system: That's good, what's the seizure frequency?
dialogue.user: My heart beats fast once a month, but it gets better quickly.

dialogue.system: How long do the symptoms last?
dialogue.user: If you reassure yourself that it's okay, you'll be fine in less than 5 minutes.

dialogue.system: Good job. You have improved a lot.
dialogue.user: Thank you.

image_caption: A 19-year-old male patient is shown on the screen. he came to me for counseling about mental illness. First of all, he's mood on the screen looks hurt.

dialogue.system: Are you in a bad mood? Talk about your panic attack symptoms.

dialogue.system: Do you have seizures when you are alone with your father?
dialogue.user: That's right.

belief_state.panic triggering situation: when i live alone with my dad

dialogue.user: I often scream out loud in anger.

dialogue.user: It's scary, I'm afraid, I think I'm going to die.
